intro: Dicliptera elegans, commonly known as the elegant dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, typical of many grass species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental appearance and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
